intro: Duvalia tuberculata, commonly known as the rough-stemmed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are often hairy and have a rough texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Duvalia tuberculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
